documents.document: if youre never scared, or embarased, or hurt, it means you never take any chances. - Julia Sorel
You are - your life, and nothing else. - Jean-Paul Sartre
To live a life is to live with struggle because life is to live and to live we struggle. - Santosh Kalwar
Your world is a living expression of how you are using and have used your mind. - Earl Nightingale
All words are pegs to hang ideas on. - Henry Ward Beecher
It's not about what you've done; it's how you've experienced whatever has happened to you. - Alexandra Robbins
People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built. - Eleanor Roosevelt
Decide what you want to be.... Pay the Price ... And be what you want to be. - John A. Widtsoe
Friendship with oneself is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world. - Eleanor Roosevelt
First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win. - Mahatma Gandhi
I'd rather die while I'm living than live while I'm dead. - Jimmy Buffett
When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you. - Lao Tzu
Relationships are like an algebraic equations:what happens on one side affect the other. - Kim Barnes
Every problem is a gift - without problems we would not grow. - Anthony Robbins
He who refuses to embrace a unique opportunity loses the prize as surely as if he had tried and failed. - William James
I think it is all a matter of love; the more you love a memory the stronger and stranger it becomes. - Vladimir Nabokov
It must have been then that I began to lose faith in reasonable argument as the sole measure of truth. - Margaret Atwood

Not being heard is no reason for silence. - Victor Hugo
A blanket attempt to avoid mistakes is the biggest mistake of all. - Steve McConnell
Mystery is the essence of divinity - Zora Neale Hurston
Sometimes you've got to be able to listen to yourself and be okay with no one else understanding. - Christopher Barzak
I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it. - Pablo Picasso
There are two kinds of failures: those who thought and never did, and those who did and never thought. - Laurence J. Peter
Great Secret: Whenever I'm learning something difficult, I keep expectations low, and aspirations high. - James Marcus Bach
Don't ever take a fence down until you know why it was put up. - Robert Frost
Women can fake an orgasm, but men can fake an entire relationship. - Sharon Stone
Someday you'll find someone special again. People who've been in love once usually do. It's in their nature. - Nicholas Sparks
Watch for the thing that will show itself to you. Because that thing, when you find it, will be your future. - Arthur Golden
The test of a mans character is not the mistakes he makes but the way he responds to them. - William Cope Moyers
People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it. - George Bernard Shaw
Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away. - Maya Angelou
Life begins on the other side of despair. - Jean-Paul Sartre
The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience. - Emily Dickinson
The sharpest criticism often goes hand in hand with the deepest idealism and love of country. - Robert F. Kennedy
An optimistic mind-set finds dozens of possible solutions for every problem that the pessimist regards as incurable. - Robert Anton Wilson
Love is a circle that doth restless move In the same sweet eternity of love. - Robert Herrick
...And we pray, not for new earth or heaven, but to be quiet in heart, and in eye clear. What we need is here. - Wendell Berry
Love is like an hourglass, with the heart filling up as the brain empties. - Jules Renard
Gradually the healing took place, seeming as it always does that it wasn't taking place. - Ursula K. Le Guin
Life can only be understood looking backward. It must be lived forward. - Eric Roth
Life is very short, and there's no time for fussing and fighting my friends - John Lennon

Life is "trying things to see if they work." - Ray Bradbury
Looking out over the courtyard at the dirty walls, he realized he had no idea whether it was hysteria or love. - Milan Kundera
The higher we soar the smaller we appear to those who cannot fly. - Friedrich Nietzsche
Not all popular novelists are good, but all good novelists are, sooner or later, popular. - Dean Koontz
Life is more or less a lie, but then again, that's exactly the way we want it to be. - Bob Dylan
Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any one thing. - Abraham Lincoln
Love has, at its best, made the inherent sadness of life bearable, and its beauty manifest. - Kay Redfield Jamison
Those who can not adjust to change will be swept aside by it. Those who recognize change and react accordingly will benefit. - Jim Rogers
Remember, goals are stars to steer by, not sticks with which to beat ourselves. - Barbara Smith
The cosmos is neither moral or immoral; only people are. He who would move the world must first move himself. - Edward Ericson
Walk on with hope in your heart, and you'll never walk alone - Shah Rukh Khan
I'd rather die while I'm living than live while I'm dead. - Jimmy Buffett
There is no real ending. It's just the place where you stop the story. - Frank Herbert
Lives, like money, are spent. What are you buying with yours? - Roy H. Williams
The true hypocrite is the one who ceases to perceive his deception, the one who lies with sincerity. - AndrÃ© Gide
Life without risk is life wasted. - Santosh Kalwar
Always remember you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world. - Harriet Tubman
Your failures will lead you to success. - Barack Obama Speeches
We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars. - Oscar Wilde
Dignity lies not in possessing honors....but in deserving them. - Aristotle
It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit. - Harry S. Truman
The mind that is wise mourns less for what age takes away; than what it leaves behind. - William Wordsworth
Remake the world, a little at a time, each in your own corner of the world. - Rick Riordan
Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless. - Mother Teresa
No amount of skillful invention can replace the essential element of imagination. - Edward Hopper
You can't do anything about the length of your life, but you can do something about its width and depth. - H.L. Mencken
The most worth-while thing is to try to put happiness into the lives of others. - Robert Baden-Powell
How much I missed, simply because I was afraid of missing it. - Paulo Coelho
Christ is not valued at all, unless he is valued above all. - Augustine of Hippo
Yesterday is history. Tomorrow is a mystery. Today is a gift. That's why we call it 'The Present'. - Eleanor Roosevelt
Time has a wonderful way to show us what really matters. - Margaret Peters
Failure? I never encountered it. All I ever met were temporary setbacks. - Dottie Walters

What baffled him was that there should be all this fuss about something so simple as love. - Gustave Flaubert
To live a life is to live with struggle because life is to live and to live we struggle. - Santosh Kalwar
Goals are not only absolutely necessary to motivate us. They are essential to really keep us alive. - Robert H. Schuller
Any accomplishment is not fulfilled without true realization of satisfaction in heart and soul. - Santosh Kalwar
It`s not how old you are, it`s how you are old. - Jules Renard
Without words, without writing and without books there would be no history, there could be no concept of humanity. - Hermann Hesse
The real lover is the man who can thrill you by kissing your forehead or smiling into your eyes or just staring into space. - Marilyn Monroe
Be glad of life because it gives you the chance to love and to work and to play and to look up at the stars. - Henry Van Dyke
I don't know what they are called, the spaces between secondsÃ¢â¬â but I think of you always in those intervals. - Salvador Plascencia
Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action. - William James
Your vision will become clear only when you look into your heart. Who looks outside, dreams. Who looks inside, awakens. - Carl Gustav Jung
Divide each difficulty into as many parts as is feasible and necessary to resolve it. - Rene Descartes
The human spirit will not invest itself in a compromise. - Robert Fritz
When we merely follow another, we take a potentially creative mind out of service-our own. - William Coperthwaite
I suffer because my interactions with others do not meet the expectations I did not know I had. - Jim McDonald
A blanket attempt to avoid mistakes is the biggest mistake of all. - Steve McConnell
The years teach much the days never know. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Your own positive future begins in this moment. All you have is right now. Every goal is possible from here. - Laozi
You are the one girl that made me risk eveything for a future worth having. - Simone Elkeles
The choice is ours to hear the echoes, to heed the call: when life isn't good, taste and see that the Lord is. - Matt Rogers
Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength. - Napoleon Bonaparte
Men and women are not limited by the place of their birth, not by color of their skin, but by the size of their hope. - John Johnson
Achievement has no color - Abraham Lincoln
Life is one fool thing after another whereas love is two fool things after each other. - Oscar Wilde
